text: Let parents bequeath to their children not riches, but the spirit of reverence.
author: Plato

text: Each day of our lives we make deposits in the memory banks of our children.
author: Charles R. Swindoll

text: Mothers - especially single mothers - are heroic in their efforts to raise our nation's children, but men must also take responsibility for their children and recognize the impact they have on their families' well-being.
author: Evan Bayh

text: Parentage is a very important profession, but no test of fitness for it is ever imposed in the interest of the children.
author: George Bernard Shaw

text: A new father quickly learns that his child invariably comes to the bathroom at precisely the times when he's in there, as if he needed company. The only way for this father to be certain of bathroom privacy is to shave at the gas station.
author: Bill Cosby
